what: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R.
title: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R.
text: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin STudy) analysis R. TWIST framework estimates ‘genetically moderated treatment effect’ (GMTE). akin population attributable fraction (PAF) pharmaco-epidemiology: excess disease outcomes individuals prescribed specific medication attributed genetic variant(s). TWIST extends PAF incorporating information treated untreated individuals. larger set information show four analysis approaches estimating GMTE possible. one relies different set assumptions work correctly provides estimates largely uncorrelated one another. decision framework used decide particular estimation strategy appropriate specific estimators can combined improve efficiency. Triangulation evidence different data sources, inherent biases limitations, becoming well established principle strengthening causal analysis. Hence called framework ‘Triangulation WIthin STudy’ (TWIST) order emphasise analysis spirit also possible within single data set, using causal estimates approximately uncorrelated, reliant different sets assumptions. TWIST therefore robustly estimates many events (outcome can mortality, disease, symptoms, etc) genotype group avoided group experience treatment effect non-carriers. Please see published paper PLoS Genetics information https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pgen.1009783 use package please cite Bowden J, Pilling L, Türkmen D, Kuo C-L, Melzer D (2021) Triangulation WIthin STudy (TWIST) framework causal inference within pharmacogenetic research. PLoS Genet 17(9):e1009783. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pgen.1009783

title: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R.
text: install development version GitHub use remotes package: periodically “release” version number works expected. development version may contain things yet “work.”
code: remotes::install_github("lukepilling/twistR") # To install the latest release, use: remotes::install_github("lukepilling/twistR@*release")  # To install a specific version (see tags), use: remotes::install_github("lukepilling/twistR@v0.1.4")

title: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R.
text: twistR can perform GMTE analysis three types outcome: 1. gmte_binary() performs logistic regression analysis binary outcome (yes/[1]/[0]). Requires margins package. 2. gmte_continuous() performs linear regression analysis continuous outcome (quantitative measure, LDL cholesterol). 3. gmte_aalen() performs Aalen additive hazards model .e. time--event analysis (mortality). Requires timereg package.

title: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R.
text: GMTE function object class twistR_GMTE returned. contains full model outputs individual analysis performed (GMTE1, GMTE0, MR, RGMTE, CAT – see paper) addition summary models performed whether models can combined improve estimation $FullCombined. example:

title: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R.
text: Prints following results table:
code: # Example using:  #   - a binary outcome (high LDL) - in data.frame D #   - a binary treatment variable (on statins) - in data.frame D #   - a binary genotype (SLCO1B1*5 homozygotes) - in data.frame D #   - adjustment for age and genetic principal components of ancestry 1 to 10 - all in data.frame D Y="ldl_high" T="statin" G="slco1b1_5_hmz" Z="age+PC1+PC2+PC3+PC4+PC5+PC6+PC7+PC8+PC9+PC10" Link="logit" results=gmte_binary(Y,T,G,Z,D,Link)

title: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R.
text: understand estimate best use, user needs consider following: * context specific treatment population, * assumptions made method whether plausible, * whether pair triplet estimates (MR RGMTE estimates) sufficiently similar combine (default alpha 0.05 Q-statistic (Qp)). Though Robust GMTE (RGMTE) estimate often appropriate, situations assumptions may satisfied combined estimate may better. reason automatically give recommendation analysis performed. combined estimates Combine? column simply reports whether p-value Q-statistic (Qp) >0.05 .e. estimates significantly differ. necesssarily mean best choice. futher information assumptions tested decision framework please see published manuscript (open access PLoS Genetics https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pgen.1009783).

title: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R.
text: can express GMTE estimand average causal effect everyone receive moderated treatment level T* = 1 (.e. full enhanced effect) versus everyone receive treatment level T* = 0 (.e. enhanced effect). binary analysis, Est risk difference people experience treatment effect genotype G=1 versus people experience treatment effect genotype G=0. continuous analysis, Est mean difference outcome (units) people experience treatment effect genotype G=1 versus people experience treatment effect genotype G=0. time--event (Aalen) analysis, Est risk difference per unit time (provided user Y_t0 Y_t1, e.g. per year time coded year scale) people experience treatment effect genotype G=1 versus people experience treatment effect genotype G=0.

title: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R.
text: paper include results analysis anti-platelet drug clopidogrel, genetic variants gene CYP2C19 impair drug metabolism reduce function, thereby increasing risk thrombosis. used Aalen additive hazards models estimate increased risk ischemic stroke UK Biobank participants prescribed clopidogrel, carried CYP2C19 Loss Function (LoF) variants (2-8). Prints following results table: (table appears Table 5 paper PLoS Genetics https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pgen.1009783) Estimating GMTE / interpreting output estimate GMTE case modelled time stroke using Aalen additive hazards model, described paper. models adjusted age recruitment first Clopidogrel prescription, sex, first 10 genetic principal components ancestry. Table show results analysis, reflect genetically moderated effect Clopidogrel treatment hazard stroke per year, expressed proportion (.e. multiply 100 get percentage, shown Table 5 paper). GMTE(1) estimate suggests CYP2C19 LoF carrier (G = 1) increases risk stroke 0.28% (p = 0.048) compared without LoF variant (G = 0). put figure context, reduce LoF carrier’s risk amount , multiplied 5264 LoF carrier patient years data, lead expected 13.2% reduction total number strokes. 110 strokes LoF group, expect reduce 15 (110 95) carriers CYP2C19 LoF variant experience treatment effect non-carriers. test potential bias GMTE(1) estimate, calculate GMTE(0) estimate untreated population. Thankfully, close zero (Hazard diff = -0.0039%, p = 0.61), although slightly negative. Taken face value, suggest LoF carriers slightly reduced risk stroke pathways Clopidogrel use. Next calculate Corrected Treated (CAT) estimate. discussed paper, validity method rests strongly able identify confounders Clopidogrel use stroke. data available, possible adjust age, sex genetic principal components perhaps unsurprisingly, CAT estimate order magnitude larger (Hazard diff = 2.2%, p=2*10−16). Consequently, Q[CAT,GMTE(1)] statistic detects large heterogeneity suggests CAT GMTE(1) estimates combined. completeness, next calculate RGMTE estimate GMTE hazard difference. Since difference GMTE(1) GMTE(0) estimates, given opposite sign, RMGTE estimate slightly larger 0.33% (p = 0.037), suggesting 17 strokes avoided. MR estimate GMTE hazard difference similar 0.29% (p = 0.008). Heterogeneity analysis reveals MR RGMTE estimates sufficiently similar combine precise single estimate GMTE (Q[MR,RGMTE] = 0.8). combined estimate 0.3 (p = 7.5*10-4), 16 strokes avoided. combination estimates sufficiently similar combine.
code: # Example using:  #   - a time-to-event model (time to ischemic stroke) - time to stroke/censoring is in "years" so output should be interpreted this way #   - a binary treatment variable (on clopidogrel) #   - a binary genotype (CYP2C19 *2-*8 LoF carriers) #   - adjustment for age and genetic principal components of ancestry 1 to 10 #     ^^ all need to be in data.frame D Y_t0="time_0" Y_t1="time_to_stroke" Y_d="stroke_binary" T="clopidogrel" G="cyp2c19_lof" Z="age+sex+PC1+PC2+PC3+PC4+PC5+PC6+PC7+PC8+PC9+PC10" results=gmte_aalen(Y_t0,Y_t1,Y_d,T,G,Z,D)

title: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R.
text: create simple Forest Plot estimates simply provide output GMTE analysis:
code: # Example using a continuous outcome (LDL), binary treatment (statins), and binary genotype (SLCO1B1*5 homozygotes) variables Y="ldl" T="statin" G="slco1b1_5_hmz" Z="age+PC1+PC2+PC3+PC4+PC5+PC6+PC7+PC8+PC9+PC10" results=gmte_continuous(Y,T,G,Z,D)  #Model                 Est          SE         EstP        Qstat        Qp Combine? #CAT          -47.79761593 0.156521799 0.000000e+00           NA        NA       NA #GMTE0         -0.02057607 0.008486743 1.533007e-02           NA        NA       NA #GMTE1          0.06984053 0.020476099 6.477051e-04           NA        NA       NA #RGMTE          0.09039080 0.022162475 4.532468e-05           NA        NA       NA #MR            -0.01003960 0.058701522 8.642019e-01           NA        NA       NA #RGMTE_MR       0.07786137 0.020733971 1.731645e-04     2.561888 0.1094678        1 #RGMTE_CAT     -0.85083255 0.021943596 0.000000e+00 91766.240141 0.0000000        0 #MR_CAT        -5.90268766 0.054963272 0.000000e+00 81719.705349 0.0000000        0 #GMTE1_CAT     -0.73556685 0.020303105 0.000000e+00 91952.071936 0.0000000        0 #RGMTE_MR_CAT  -0.74774632 0.020554416 0.000000e+00 91946.240796 0.0000000        0  # plot these estimates, highlighting the individual and combined estimates gmte_plot(results, plot_title = "SLCO1B1*5 effect on LDL during statin treatment")

title: TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R.
text: previously mentioned, validity CAT method rests strongly able identify confounders treatment outcome. analysis possible adjust age, sex genetic principal components. Therefore CAT estimate disproportionately larger consequently, Q[CAT,GMTE(1)] statistic detects large heterogeneity, suggesting CAT GMTE(1) estimates combined.
code: gmte_plot(results, plot_title = "SLCO1B1*5 effect on LDL during statin treatment", plot_cat=FALSE)

title: gmte_aalen — gmte_aalen
text: Performs analyses Triangulation WIthin STudy (TWIST) framework calcuate ‘genetically moderated treatment effect’ (GMTE) time--event Aalen additive hazards model. gmte_aalen function returns object class twistR_GMTE, containing effect estimates individual tests (RGMTE) results combinations performed (RGMTE+MR).

title: gmte_aalen — gmte_aalen
code: gmte_aalen(   Y_t0,   Y_t1,   Y_d,   T,   G,   Z,   D,   Nsim = 100,   alpha = 0.05,   verbose = FALSE )

title: gmte_aalen — gmte_aalen
text: Y_t0 Variable name (string) participants "enter" model, appears data.frame D. participants enter model (can 0s Y_t1 time since start exposure). Variable can date format .Date() function, numeric. Y_t1 Variable name (string) participants "exit" model, appears data.frame D. Either days since start exposure period (numeric) date format .Date() function. Y_d Variable name binary "event" variable (string) appears data.frame D. T treatment variable name (string) appears data.frame D. Assumed binary. G genotype variable name (string) appears data.frame D. Normally binary (e.g. comparing homozygous rare individuals rest population) can additive (0, 1, 2) score multiple variants desired. Z string containing model covariates appear glm() models (example "age+sex"). need data.frame D. D data.frame containing variables. Nsim Number simulations perform aalen() models. Default 100. alpha p-value threshold chi-square test, estimating whether two estimates combined. Default 0.05. verbose Return lots output - useful error checking. Default FALSE.

title: gmte_aalen — gmte_aalen
text: object class twistR_GMTE containing following components: CAT summary statistics Corrected Treated (CAT) analysis. GMTE1 summary statistics GMTE(1) analysis (.e. treated individuals). GMTE0 summary statistics GMTE(0) analysis (.e. untreated individuals). MR summary statistics MR analysis. RGMTE summary statistics Robust GMTE analysis (GMTE1 corrected GMTE0). FullCombined combined summary statistics analyses performed, inclduing combinations.

title: gmte_aalen — gmte_aalen
text: Bowden, J., et al., Triangulation WIthin STudy (TWIST) framework causal inference within Pharmacogenetic research. PLoS Genetics. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pgen.1009783

title: gmte_aalen — gmte_aalen
text: Jack Bowden; Luke Pilling.

title: gmte_aalen — gmte_aalen
code: # Example using a time-to-event outcome (mortality), binary treatment (statins), and binary genotype (SLCO1B1*5 homozygotes) variables Y_t0="date_first_statin" Y_t1="date_of_death_or_censor" Y_d="dead" T="statin" G="slco1b1_5_hmz" Z="age+PC1+PC2+PC3+PC4+PC5+PC6+PC7+PC8+PC9+PC10" results=gmte_aalen(Y_t0,Y_t1,Y_d,T,G,Z,D) #> TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R - Aalen additive hazards (time-to-event) model #> Error in gmte_aalen(Y_t0, Y_t1, Y_d, T, G, Z, D): D needs to be a data.frame

title: gmte_binary — gmte_binary
text: Performs analyses Triangulation WIthin STudy (TWIST) framework calcuate ‘genetically moderated treatment effect’ (GMTE) binary outcome. gmte_binary function returns object class twistR_GMTE, containing effect estimates individual tests (RGMTE) results combinations performed (RGMTE+MR).

title: gmte_binary — gmte_binary
code: gmte_binary(Y, T, G, Z, D, Link = "logit", alpha = 0.05, verbose = FALSE)

title: gmte_binary — gmte_binary
text: Y binary outcome variable name (string) appears data.frame D. T treatment variable name (string) appears data.frame D. Assumed binary. G genotype variable name (string) appears data.frame D. Normally binary (e.g. comparing homozygous rare individuals rest population) can additive (0, 1, 2) score multiple variants desired. Z string containing model covariates appear glm() models (example "age+sex"). need data.frame D. D data.frame containing variables. Link Link function glm() - needs one "logit","probit" "identity". unspecified default "logit". alpha p-value threshold chi-square test, estimating whether two estimates combined. Default 0.05. verbose Return lots output - useful error checking. Default FALSE.

title: gmte_binary — gmte_binary
text: object class twistR_GMTE containing following components: CAT summary statistics Corrected Treated (CAT) analysis. GMTE1 summary statistics GMTE(1) analysis (.e. treated individuals). GMTE0 summary statistics GMTE(0) analysis (.e. untreated individuals). MR summary statistics MR analysis. RGMTE summary statistics Robust GMTE analysis (GMTE1 corrected GMTE0). FullCombined combined summary statistics analyses performed, inclduing combinations.

title: gmte_binary — gmte_binary
text: Bowden, J., et al., Triangulation WIthin STudy (TWIST) framework causal inference within Pharmacogenetic research. PLoS Genetics. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pgen.1009783

title: gmte_binary — gmte_binary
text: Jack Bowden; Luke Pilling.

title: gmte_binary — gmte_binary
code: # Example using a binary outcome (high LDL), binary treatment (statins), and binary genotype (SLCO1B1*5 homozygotes) variables Y="ldl_high" T="statin" G="slco1b1_5_hmz" Z="age+PC1+PC2+PC3+PC4+PC5+PC6+PC7+PC8+PC9+PC10" Link="logit" results=gmte_binary(Y,T,G,Z,D,Link) #> TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R - binary outcome #> Error in gmte_binary(Y, T, G, Z, D, Link): D needs to be a data.frame

title: gmte_combine — gmte_combine
text: Internal function combine estimates multiple models provide summary statistics

title: gmte_combine — gmte_combine
text: Ests estimates. SEs Standard Errors estimates. alpha Significance threshold (default 0.05)

title: gmte_combine — gmte_combine
text: object containing combined estimate (plus SE, P, Q statistic)

G genotype variable name (string) appears data.frame D. Normally binary (e.g. comparing homozygous rare individuals rest population) can additive (0, 1, 2) score multiple variants desired. Z string containing model covariates appear glm() models (example "age+sex"). need data.frame D. D data.frame containing variables. alpha p-value threshold chi-square test, estimating whether two estimates combined. Default 0.05. verbose Return lots output - useful error checking. Default FALSE.

GMTE0 summary statistics GMTE(0) analysis (.e. untreated individuals). MR summary statistics MR analysis. RGMTE summary statistics Robust GMTE analysis (GMTE1 corrected GMTE0). what: Forest plot individual and combined TWIST/GMTE estimates — gmte_plot
title: Forest plot individual and combined TWIST/GMTE estimates — gmte_plot
text: Plot individual combined estimates Triangulation WIthin STudy (TWIST) analysis. gmte_plot function takes object class twistR_GMTE, containing effect estimates individual tests (RGMTE) results combinations performed (RGMTE+MR), creates forest plot, highlighting individual combined estimates, indicating "*" combined estimate may valid.

title: Forest plot individual and combined TWIST/GMTE estimates — gmte_plot
code: gmte_plot(   x,   plot_title = "",   plot_cat = TRUE,   cols = c("#f46036", "#2e294e", "#1b998b"),   pchs = c(15, 16, 23) )

title: Forest plot individual and combined TWIST/GMTE estimates — gmte_plot
text: x object class twistR_GMTE e.g., output gmte_continuous plot_title string print plot title plot_cat Logical. Plot CAT estimates? (Default=TRUE) cols Three colours indiciate three model types (GMTE0, individual estimates, combined estimates) pchs Three point types indiciate three model types (GMTE0, individual estimates, combined estimates)

title: Forest plot individual and combined TWIST/GMTE estimates — gmte_plot
text: Bowden, J., et al., Triangulation WIthin STudy (TWIST) framework causal inference within Pharmacogenetic research. PLoS Genetics. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pgen.1009783

title: Forest plot individual and combined TWIST/GMTE estimates — gmte_plot
text: Jack Bowden; Luke Pilling.

title: Forest plot individual and combined TWIST/GMTE estimates — gmte_plot
code: # Example using a continuous outcome (LDL), binary treatment (statins), and binary genotype (SLCO1B1*5 homozygotes) variables Y="ldl" T="statin" G="slco1b1_5_hmz" Z="age+PC1+PC2+PC3+PC4+PC5+PC6+PC7+PC8+PC9+PC10" results=gmte_continuous(Y,T,G,Z,D) #> TWIST (Triangulation WIthin A STudy) analysis in R - continuous outcome #> Error in gmte_continuous(Y, T, G, Z, D): D needs to be a data.frame  gmte_plot(results, plot_title = "SLCO1B1*5 effect on LDL during statin treatment") #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'results' not found  # If desired, remove CAT estimates for "cleaner" plot, as these are often orders of magnititude larger than the other estimates gmte_plot(results, plot_title = "SLCO1B1*5 effect on LDL during statin treatment", plot_cat=FALSE) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'results' not found

title: twistR 0.1.4.9000 (6 June 2024)
text: Change URL reflect GitHub username change lukepilling lcpilling consistent different logins, websites, social media https://lcpilling.github.io/twistR https://github.com/lcpilling/twistR

title: twistR 0.1.4
text: FullCombined object now data.frame column “Model” rather using rownames matrix New function gmte_plot() creates forest plot estimates provided twistR_GMTE object

title: twistR 0.1.3
text: Fix bug gmte_combine function fails CAT estimate doesn’t converge - allows returning GMTE (etc) even failure one estimate

title: twistR 0.1.2
text: Add ‘verbose’ option help error checking/debugging, user simply wants lots output.

title: twistR 0.1.1
text: Update calculation Tshat use linear regression model throughout. Allows use multi-allelic genetic variants.

title: twistR 0.1.0
text: First release package.
